title: 'Security issue': B'desh halts visa services in India; bilateral ties reach new low
content: Bangladesh's interim government has temporarily suspended visa services at its key diplomatic missions in India, including New Delhi, citing "security concerns." This move follows similar restrictions by India on Bangladeshi nationals. Dhaka is also seeking a reversal of United States visa bond requirement, deeming it "certainly unfortunate and painful for them."

title: Russian oil purchase: How 500% tariff could upend India-US trade - explained
content: US President Donald Trump has backed a bill that could levy 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian oil, giving the US leverage over major buyers such as China and India to curb imports from Moscow.

title: 'Time will tell ...': Trump's big hint on how long US will 'run' Venezuela; Caracas trip soon?
content: US President Donald Trump declared that America "will control Venezuela's vast oil reserves" for an extended period, asserting dominance following the capture of President Maduro. Despite Venezuela's interim leader denying foreign governance, the US plans to manage oil sales, using proceeds for American products. This move aims to secure US interests and lower global oil prices.

title: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis hints Google triggered OpenAI ‘Code Red’
content: Google's Gemini is rapidly gaining ground on ChatGPT, showing significant month-over-month growth and capturing a substantial portion of its rival's audience. This surge has prompted OpenAI to issue an internal 'code red' warning, as Google's integrated infrastructure and full-stack approach appear to be giving it a decisive edge in the competitive AI chatbot landscape.

title: Chess Controversy! Praggnanandhaa stops clock; draw call sparks uproar - Watch
content: A controversial moment dominated Day 2 of the Tata Steel Chess India Rapid in Kolkata when R Praggnanandhaa stopped the clock with one second left, leading to a disputed draw against Wesley So. Arbiter Chris Bird said it should have been a loss under chess laws. Elsewhere, Viswanathan Anand rebounded to joint lead with Nihal Sarin, while Kateryna Lagno topped the women’s standings.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: Stefon Diggs–Cardi B drama grows as Patriots playoff distraction
content: The New England Patriots are winning, but celebrity drama, particularly involving Stefon Diggs and Cardi B, overshadows their on-field success. While quarterback Drake Maye shows promise, Diggs' crucial role in the offense is undeniable. Coach Mike Vrabel attempts to maintain focus amidst the off-field noise, but the team's playoff hopes hinge on managing these distractions.

title: Philanthropy push: Jeff Bezos’ ex-wife donates billions to non-profits; biggest giveaway in 2025
content: Mackenzie Scott, ex-wife of Amazon's founder, has significantly reduced her stake in the e-commerce giant, selling shares worth $13 billion.  She continues her massive philanthropic efforts, donating $7.1 billion to non-profits in 2025 alone, including over $1.2 billion to Historically Black Colleges and Universities.  These substantial, unrestricted grants are seen as a counterpoint to tech companies scaling back DEI initiatives.

title: Is LaMelo Ball playing vs Pacers tonight? Latest Hornets injury update
content: LaMelo Ball's availability for the Charlotte Hornets' home game against the Indiana Pacers remains uncertain due to right ankle issues.  The team awaits a final decision, with Ball's status a key factor for the 7:00 PM ET tip-off.  Meanwhile, the Pacers are significantly shorthanded with multiple key players sidelined, including Tyrese Haliburton.

title: 'Energy greed': Venezuela acting prez calls out Trump; leaves door open for Russia, China
content: Venezuela's interim President Delcy Rodriguez has accused the US of using false claims about drugs and human rights as a pretext to seize the nation's oil. She stated Venezuela is open to mutually beneficial energy partnerships with clearly defined commercial contracts. This comes as the US announced it would manage future Venezuelan crude sales and oversee its global petroleum trade.

title: Candace Owens questions Charlie Kirk after sharing unseen image with no blood
content: Candace Owens shared claims about a photo she says shows Charlie Kirk after an alleged shooting. She questioned the official story and named people she said could not be trusted. However, there is no verified evidence, police record, or official confirmation that Charlie Kirk was shot or killed. Her statements remain unproven and widely disputed.

title: Tommy Fleetwood & Clare Fleetwood net worth: Golf earnings, sponsors, family
content: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Travis Kelce hits breaking point as Taylor Swift reaches new career high
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Another strong-arm killing in polarized America inflames divisions
content: A shooting incident in Minneapolis involving an immigration enforcement agent and a woman has ignited fierce debate. Republicans claim self-defense against a resisting driver. Democrats and local officials dispute this, calling the agent trigger-happy. The event, near where George Floyd died, has intensified tensions in the city. The woman's family describes her as a devoted mother and poet.

title: Russia, minerals or whim? Why Trump is after Greenland – and what are his options
content: President Trump's ambition to acquire Greenland has ignited a diplomatic crisis with Denmark. While the US cites national security and Arctic interests, allies fear a return to expansionism.  Despite Denmark's offers of increased cooperation, Trump's focus on territorial acquisition, driven by symbolism and a desire to expand US landmass, perplexes many.

title: From Op Sindoor to Venezuela: How Chinese weapons, radars keep failing — Explained
content: China's arms exports faced a significant setback as its weapons, including air defence systems like the HQ-9 and JY-27A radar, proved ineffective during India's Operation Sindoor and a recent Venezuelan operation. These incidents highlighted a technological gap, with Russian-supplied missiles also failing to perform. The failures have damaged China's reputation as a reliable arms supplier.

title: ICE kills woman: Protestors clash with federal agents, 3 held; Minneapolis on edge
content: A woman was fatally shot by an ICE officer in Minneapolis during an immigration crackdown, sparking protests and clashes with law enforcement. State and local officials demanded ICE leave Minnesota, but Homeland Security stated agents would remain. The incident is being investigated, with conflicting accounts from officials and eyewitnesses.

title: IND vs NZ: Tilak Varma ruled out of first three T20Is; BCCI issues injury update
content: Indian batter Tilak Varma has undergone emergency abdominal surgery in Rajkot and will miss the first three T20Is against New Zealand. The 23-year-old is recovering well and has been discharged from the hospital. His availability for the remaining matches and the T20 World Cup opener remains uncertain as he begins his return-to-training process.

title: Question raised! 'The game needs to evolve': Uthappa on ICC tournament every year
content: Former India cricketer Robin Uthappa questioned the need for hosting an ICC tournament every year, saying the novelty of multi-nation events is wearing off. Speaking during the SA20 in Durban, he urged administrators to revisit scheduling to preserve value for fans. Uthappa also reminisced about Durban and the 2007 T20 World Cup bowl-out win against Pakistan, calling it a special and well-prepared moment for the Indian team.

title: 'Axis of war': Russia warns EU over peacekeeping force in Ukraine; takes shot at US
content: Russia has branded Ukraine and its allies an "axis of war," calling the proposed peacekeeping force deployments plan "dangerous" and "destructive". Moscow warned that any such troops would be considered legitimate military targets. This strong reaction follows new security guarantees announced for Kyiv. Meanwhile, the US seized a Russian-flagged tanker, which Moscow claims will escalate tensions.

title: More trouble looms for India as Trump greenlights harsher sanctions bill
content: President Trump has greenlit a bipartisan bill authorizing significant sanctions and up to 500% tariffs on countries buying Russian energy. The Sanctioning Russia Act aims to pressure nations like China, India, and Brazil, part of the BRICS block, to cease fueling Russia's war machine.

title: Ashes: 'Sold a lie for three years' - Boycott rips into England
content: Former England opener Geoffrey Boycott has sharply criticised England after their Ashes defeat, accusing Brendon McCullum, Rob Key and Ben Stokes of promoting a flawed, consequence-free philosophy. Boycott said players lacked accountability despite early success under McCullum-Stokes. Selection issues and injuries hurt England’s bowling, while Jacob Bethell’s Sydney hundred showed the promise.

title: Chanakyaneeti or sidelined: Why is Vance missing from Trump's Venezuela triumph?
content: While Trump’s inner circle toasted the capture of Nicolás Maduro, a spectacle equal parts action movie and reality show, the Vice President was nowhere to be seen. In the impromptu “war room” where Trump green-lit the raid on Caracas, Vance’s chair was reportedly empty. And when the administration brass held a press conference to celebrate their “perfect” operation, Vance was again absent, leaving Rubio to play the starring role as the public face of America’s newest foreign intervention.

title: Istanbul storm caught on camera; video shows plane wobbling mid-landing — video
content: Istanbul faced a powerful storm with gale-force winds and towering waves, causing widespread disruption. A Pegasus flight aborted landing due to severe weather, while sea transport across western Turkiye, including the Bosphorus and Dardanelles, was heavily impacted. Fallen trees and localized flooding were reported in several provinces.

title: The heat of air conditioners: How climate change is driving up power bills— a closer look
content: Soaring temperatures are escalating global electricity demand, particularly for cooling, leading to price hikes and straining energy grids. India's consumption is surging, with a heavy reliance on coal exacerbating emissions. While renewable energy is growing, the article highlights the urgent need for cleaner solutions to prevent electricity from fueling the climate crisis it aims to combat.

title: 'Economic blockade': Kerala CM targets Centre; calls for satyagraha on Jan 12
content: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has accused the Centre of a "financial stranglehold" and announced a satyagraha protest on January 12 against an alleged "economic blockade." He also criticised Congress, saying that "the party, which claims to be the principal opposition party of the country, is also moving along the same path" as the central govt.

title: Ruturaj creates history: Cricketer breaks multiple records; surpasses Kohli and Babar
content: Ruturaj Gaikwad smashed a brilliant 134 in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, reaching his 20th List A century in a record 95 innings. He also became the fastest to 5,000 List A runs. Despite stellar domestic form and a recent ODI century, Gaikwad's omission from the upcoming India squad raises eyebrows. He will lead CSK in IPL 2026.

title: 'Donroe' doctrine: 5 reasons why Trump's Maduro shock was not about oil. It was a msg for Xi
content: The US seizure of Nicolas Maduro and control over Venezuela's oil marks a significant blow to China's influence in Latin America. This move, rerouting billions in crude to the US, undermines Beijing's decade-long economic diplomacy and its strategy of championing sovereignty. It signals that economic ties don't guarantee protection against US military power.

title: Delhi’s private schools can’t shake off fee committees: HC extends deadlines, autonomy under challenge
content: Fee regulation committees will move forward in Delhi’s private schools—for now. The High Court declined to stay the government notification but extended deadlines for setting up committees and submitting proposed fee structures. The petitioners argue the 2025 law is unconstitutional and creates overlapping controls with the 1973 Act. Schools call it intrusive as the dispute now heads to further hearings—and may travel beyond the High Court.

title: The long arm of law catches up with former Kerala Minister in evidence-tampering case
content: It took three decades for a case booked for criminal conspiracy and causing disappearance of evidence against a legislator in Kerala to be decided by a trial court. Sarath Babu George tracks the legal and investigative processes that culminated in the conviction and subsequent disqualification of Antony Raju

title: Amit Shah reviews security situation in J&K
content: Union Home Minister directs security agencies to ensure the goal of ‘terror-free Jammu and Kashmir’ is achieved at the earliest

title: The making of a Jallikattu bull
content: In Thottiapatti near Madurai, a hub for buying and rearing jallikattu bulls, economy is built around native breeds

title: BJP suspends three members in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The three were suspended for allegedly working to defeat the party’s candidates in three wards of the Corporation in the recently held local body elections

title: Three Indians among crew on board Russian oil tanker seized by U.S.: report
content: U.S. government had been repeatedly provided with reliable information, including from the Russian Foreign Ministry, about the ship’s Russian origin and its civilian status, Moscow asserted

title: Average asset of 102 re-elected MPs rises by 110% between 2014-2024: ADR
content: The top ten MPs who registered the highest increase in their assets, includes BJP's Udayanraje Bhonsle, Poonamben Maadam, Hema Malini, Nishikant Dubey; YSRCP's PV Midhun Reddy; Shiromani Akali Dal's Harsimrat Kaur Badal; Trinamool Congress' Shatrughan Sinha; and NCP (SP)'s Supriya Sule

title: Gadgil was a man of compassion, remembers V.S. Vijayan
content: Ecologist Vijayan, a long-time associate of Gadgil, says the latter rooted his approach in science and ecology, and always chose to air his views frankly and fearlessly.

title: Kerala CM accuses Congress of seeking to lionise Donald Trump by racing to name a road in his honour in Andhra Pradesh
content: Pinarayi Vijayan says Congress and BJP were equally subservient to the U.S.’s expansionist capitalism. He urges Centre to dispatch a bipartisan political delegation to Venezuela to express solidarity

title: Ecologist’s advocacy shaped political and ecological narratives in Kerala
content: Eminent ecologist’s contributions shaped socio-political and ecological narratives of the State over one and a half decades in an unprecedented manner

title: Congress voices concern over ‘turbulent times’ in Indo-U.S. relations
content: Jairam Ramesh points to recent legislative and political signals from Washington that have caused discomfort in New Delhi; he also cites Trump’s praise for Pakistan Army chief Asim Munir

title: Enquiry into private universities is neither a witch-hunt nor playing ‘headmaster’: SC
content: A Bench headed by Justice Ahsanuddin Amanullah pulled up the Centre for not filing an affidavit affirmed by the Union Cabinet Secretary despite a categorical order from the top court in November 2025

title: Dravidian model views technology as a tool for social uplift, says Chief Minister M.K. Stalin
content: Speaking at the fourth edition of UmagineTN, he says the State is shifting from its traditional information technology services to high-tech development, start-ups, and innovation-driven economy

title: A.P. should emerge as national role model in mangrove conservation, says Pawan
content: The Deputy CM stresses that protecting existing mangroves while expanding new plantations is essential to minimise losses caused by frequent natural disasters, particularly in the Krishna and Godavari basins

title: Karnataka State Film Awards 2020 and 2021: M.S. Sathyu honoured with Puttanna Kanagal Award
content: Legendary filmmaker M.S. Sathyu clinched Puttanna Kanagal Award for 2020, while popular actor Jayamala took home Dr. Rajkumar Award

title: J&K CM to find room for 50 MBBS students left high and dry by Vaishno Devi college
content: The CM stressed that the students cleared NEET on merit and it is our legal responsibility to adjust them

title: BJP MP, State government at odds in Chhattisgarh over Scouts and Guides jamboree
content: Raipur MP Brijmohan Agrawal challenges removal as State Bharat Scouts and Guides president ahead of national event

title: Congress seeks clarification from Centre, M.P. govt. on Indore deaths; alleges criminal negligence
content: Congress spokesperson Pawan Khera says the tragedy exposed the ‘ugly, brutal and utterly callous face of the BJP govt.’; adds that mandatory quarterly water quality tests were not conducted, monitoring reports were not prepared or submitted, and key infrastructure projects remained incomplete or poorly managed in Madhya Pradesh

title: Govt. seeks feedback on draft Bill to regulate pesticides, promote ‘safe and effective’ use
content: The Bill strives to minimise risk to human beings, animals, living organisms other than pests, and the environment, and promote pesticides that are “biological and based on traditional knowledge”

title: 4 PJTAU staff suspended for question paper leakage
content: 35 on-service students of 3rd year surrendered to Agri. Dept. for their involvement in the irregularity

title: Hindu man lynched in Bangladesh: Main accused held; 21 arrested so far
content: Police arrested Yasin Arafat, the main suspect in the murder of Hindu worker Dipu Chandra Das. Arafat, a former madrasa teacher, allegedly led a mob that attacked and killed Das. This incident follows a period of unrest in Bangladesh. Twenty-one people have been arrested in connection with the case. Nine have given confessional statements.

title: Drama at PSL! Ex-franchise owner withdraws: 'South Punjab is where my heart is'
content: Former Multan Sultans owner Ali Khan Tareen has withdrawn from the PSL auction for two new franchises being held in Islamabad. Announcing his decision on X, Tareen said his PSL journey was about representing South Punjab, not business. He plans to watch as a fan this year but hinted at a return if Multan is sold again. Nine bidders remain in the race.

title: AI, IT and yes, booze too: Gujarat’s big GIFT City push
content: Gujarat is launching a major push into AI and the digital economy with a dedicated IT-AI cluster near GIFT City and the establishment of the Indian AI Research Organisation (IAIRO). These initiatives aim to attract global tech giants, foster innovation, and position the state as a national and global hub for emerging technologies.

title: Exclusive: Why no Hikaru? Inside new FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship
content: FIDE and Freestyle Chess ended a long-running dispute over world championship authority by agreeing to stage the first official FIDE Freestyle Chess World Championship. The conflict began in late 2024 over title rights, sparking public clashes and player concerns. A renewed dialogue in 2025 led to reconciliation, aligning Freestyle’s tour with FIDE governance and creating a unified championship framework.

title: India and Iran to start diplomatic calendar for 75th anniversary of bilateral ties
content: The celebration of bilateral ties will begin with the visit of Iran Foreign Minister Syed Abbas Araghchi that is expected later this month

title: Watch: Demolition drive around Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque in Delhi triggers clashes | Ground Report
content: A late-night demolition to remove encroachments around the Faiz-e-Ilahi Mosque at Turkman Gate, carried out on Delhi High Court directions, led to stone-pelting, injuries to police personnel and multiple arrests.

title: Increased money in politics and drugs on the streets needs to be analysed: Raj Thackeray
content: In an interview with a regional channel, Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj said that the people were being neglected, and power was being misused. They highlighted their agenda over how the Marathi Manoos have been exploited and betrayed, and how migration has taken away the rights of locals

title: Amid Kogilu row, BDA takes up demolition near Thanisandra without notices; Commissioner orders probe
content: While BDA maintains that 13 houses are demolished, residents say that more than 20 houses are affected; Many of the displaced families were tenants who had been living in the area for nearly five years

title: PM Modi to visit Somnath Temple on January 11, hold yatra
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi recalled his earlier visits to Somnath Temple and spoke about the resilience of faith despite repeated attacks on the shrine by invaders

title: Mamata to protest in Kolkata against ED raids on IPAC office
content: The Trinamool chief says the raids are “politically motivated to steal party data”, including candidate list for the upcoming elections

title: BJP stages protest for second day over police ‘disrobing’ woman during arrest
content: After their protest till late evening in Hubballi on Wednesday, the BJP workers staged another protest on Thursday, this time in Dharwad

title: DGP, CoP must explain inaction against those who used filthy language in the presence of retired judge: HC
content: Justices G. Jayachandran and K. Kumaresh Babu call for an explanation after former judge V. Parthiban writes to the court narrating the incident

title: Denmark explores collaboration with Kudumbashree in the field of elderly care
content: The discussions centered on training Kudumbashree workers to serve as social healthcare helpers in Denmark, building on the success of the K for Care project, which has already trained over a thousand caregivers in Kerala. The move requires more extensive training and Danish language studies.

title: Cabinet gives nod for setting up AP Logistics Infrastructure Corporation, AP Logistics Fund
content: Among others, it clears the proposal to bear the burden of true-up electricity charges by repaying to the DISCOMs in six monthly instalments

title: Greater Noida residents seek pipeline audit after suspected water contamination
content: Residents said they had raised repeated complaints with GNIDA for several months, but alleged that the problem persisted with over 15 locals falling ill in the past several days

title: Jagan making frantic efforts to stay relevant, says Health Minister Satya Kumar
content: The YSRCP government took up several projects without permission, which were later halted by the National Green Tribunal, says the Minister

title: NITI Aayog recognises Kerala’s LIFE Mission as best model for affordable housing
content: In a recent report, NITI Aayog describes LIFE Mission as a ‘multi-faceted convergence and community-based model,’ noting that it effectively brings together resources of various departments and local self-government institutions to address the housing needs of the poor

title: Pedamadduru farmers give away 313 acres within an hour of launching LPS
content: Amaravati will be developed strictly in accordance with the Green Tribunal permissions, says Minister Narayana, reiterating that the government will fulfil every promise made to the farmers

title: Kerala government issues guidelines for antibiotic-smart certification of hospitals, LSGs
content: Move as part of government’s initiative to tackle antimicrobial resistance. Innovative accreditation system has been developed by identifying key performance indicators and giving weightages to each to arrive at a performance score for certification

title: Situation in State-run universities in Tamil Nadu worrisome: Governor Ravi
content: Several institutions from Tamil Nadu had figured in the top 20 NIRF rankings, but there were hardly any State-run institutions on the list, he says

title: J.B. Koshy Commission’s recommendations are being implemented: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan
content: The panel was formed to study the educational, economic, and welfare issues facing Christian minorities. Since the commission submitted its report in May 2023, 17 departments have implemented 220 of the 284 recommendations and sub-recommendations.

title: Suspected hashish oil seized from Kannur Central Jail inmate
content: The contraband stored in two small bottles, recovered from a convict; Kannur Town police register case

title: NHRC issues notice to Gujarat government over surge in the typhoid cases in Gandhinagar
content: A total of 70 active typhoid cases is concentrated in a particular area of the city, exposing serious flaws in the newly laid water supply system in Gandhinagar City

title: Court proceedings halted in Idukki after a hoax bomb threat
content: The threat was sent to the District Judge’s official email address under the name of a “Tamil Liberation” organisation

title: Big plans to develop tourism in Andhra Pradesh
content: APTDC signs MoUs worth ₹19,000 crore, renames Haritha Hotels as ‘Haritha Punnami’, and enhances accident insurance coverage for all employees from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh, says official

title: Barnwell predicts the NFL playoff bracket: Could two lower seeds go to the Super Bowl?
content: Four road teams winning in the wild-card round -- and two of them making it all the way to the Super Bowl? Let's project the full playoffs.

title: Fins fire coach McDaniel; GM hire expected soon
content: The Dolphins have fired coach Mike McDaniel after Miami finished 7-10, its second straight season missing the playoffs.

title: Sources: Bucs fire OC as part of staff overhaul
content: Josh Grizzard has been fired by the Buccaneers after only one season as their offensive coordinator, sources told ESPN.

title: Stone-faced Cignetti vows 'I am happy, at times'
content: Curt Cignetti's demeanor during games has made the transformative Hoosiers coach into a meme, but Cignetti says he is having some fun during Indiana's historic rise, just not in front of the camera.

title: Falcons to interview ex-QB Ryan for new prez role
content: The Falcons will interview former franchise quarterback Matt Ryan, among others, for a new role entitled the "president of football," owner Arthur Blank said Thursday at a news conference.

title: Giannis says he would 'never' ask Bucks for trade
content: Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo says there "will never be a chance, and there will never be a moment" that he asks the team to trade him, adding he plans to be with Milwaukee for the rest of his career.

title: Rodman returns to USWNT for January friendlies
content: Forward Trinity Rodman, who is out of contract with a club, will join the United States women's national team in training camp later this month for the first time since April 2025.

title: Chiefs 'aware' of abuse allegations by Rice's ex
content: The Chiefs acknowledged Wednesday that they are aware of domestic violence allegations made by a woman who is the ex-girlfriend of Rashee Rice, with the team saying it's in communication with the league and will have no additional comment at this time.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: 🏀 Six NBA trade offers to reshape playoff chase
content: Let's help Milwaukee build around Giannis, the Lakers and the Timberwolves fill major needs, and Golden State end its long saga.

title: 'What if we are the people who win these games?' A new feeling at Ole Miss
content: After a chaotic month, Ole Miss won the kind of game it always loses, leaving its fans wondering how far it can go.

title: Why did the Dolphins fire Mike McDaniel now? Answering key questions
content: McDaniel seemed safe for a minute, but the Dolphins fired their head coach. What's next for them and McDaniel?

title: Grading the Trae Young trade: How did the Hawks and Wizards fare?
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: MLB Power Rankings: Where every team stands in the new year
content: Though there are still free agents to be signed, let's reassess the standings now that we're midway through the offseason.

title: The bizarre world of arbitration -- and the ace whose record raise could rock the system
content: Baseball's unique offseason contract process is built on comps. Enter the pitcher who is beyond comparison.

title: Browns locked in for 'next 120 days': Coach, draft and a QB
content: Are Cleveland's owners letting a 5-12 season weigh them down? Not a chance. They're pressing forward.

title: 'Even if it's not safe, I still want to play': What NHL players, owners, execs are saying about Olympic ice
content: While the rink won't be perfect, there's also an overwhelming sentiment shared by all stakeholders: The men's Olympic hockey tournament will go on.

title: Connelly breaks down Miami-Ole Miss, Oregon-Indiana
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: Live trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: Here's every trade of this regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: Power Rankings: Unbeaten Vanderbilt, Nebraska crack top 10
content: The Commodores and Cornhuskers have outperformed preseason expectations, headlining this week's biggest risers.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Must-see FA Cup games: Wrexham take on Premier League side, Rosenior's Chelsea debut
content: Which FA Cup hopefuls are primed for an upset? Can Liam Rosenior win his first match as Chelsea manager? Here are eight can't-miss matches.

title: Secret sauce to Bills beating the Jaguars? A big key is the O-line
content: What makes up the Bills O-line unit's success and its diverse personalities off the field? Let them explain.

title: Mendoza vs. Moore: Why the CFP semifinals will have a big impact on the NFL draft
content: New York Jets GM Darren Mougey will be heavily evaluating quarterbacks in the college playoffs ahead of the draft.

title: Buzz: Hoosiers-Ducks winner likely to be favorite in national championship game
content: The winner of Friday's semifinal between Indiana and Oregon is expected to be the favorite in the national title game, regardless of opponent.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: Newest layer in the Packers-Bears rivalry? Cheese grater hats
content: DJ Moore's celebration helped turn a foam cheese grater hat into the latest Bears-Packers rivalry fixture.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Karl to commit to Bayern after Real Madrid comments
content: Bayern Munich's teenage star Lennart Karl recently courted interest from Real Madrid but is ready to commit his long-term future to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Men's hockey check-in: Which teams are poised for a Frozen Four run?
content: A look at the top storylines, players to watch and Frozen Four picks as we hit the season's second half.

content: Our panel of fantasy basketball experts lists their biggest surprises and disappointments so far this season.

content: An early look at the top 200 QBs, RBs, WRs and TEs for 2026 drafts, updated throughout the fantasy football offseason.

content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Ja'Marr Chase offered an ARC Raiders player Bengals season tickets for a revive
content: The Cincinnati Bengals wide receiver tried to bargain for his virtual life in ARC Raiders -- to no avail.

title: Lautaro Martínez leads Team of the Week 17 in EA FC 26
content: Argentinian striker Lautaro Martnez scored and assisted one time each against FC Bologna . the midfielder secured himself a 90 OVR card with 90 Shooting . Declan Rice also managed to snag a second TOTW appearance in this week's selection .

title: Stray Dogs Sense Fear, May Attack People Who Are Scared: Top Court
content: While continuing its hearing in the suo motu case on stray dog management in public spaces, the Supreme Court on Thursday remarked that dogs are capable of sensing fear and may attack individuals who are frightened or who have earlier been bitten.

title: 'Never Spoke To Umar Khalid In 5 Years': Sharjeel Imam On Delhi Riots Case
content: Activist Sharjeel Imam on Thursday concluded his arguments before a Delhi court against the framing of charges in the alleged "larger conspiracy" case linked to the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots, stating that he never supported violence and had no coord

title: Indian AI Startups Should Work Towards Global Leadership, Says PM Modi
content: PM Modi  said the world's trust in India is its biggest strength and emphasised the need to ensure that Indian Artificial Intelligence (AI) models are ethical, unbiased, transparent, and based on data privacy principles.

title: "Mamata Banerjee Obstructed Probe": Central Agency ED Approaches High Court
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has walked out with a laptop, phone and multiple documents from the house of Prateek Jain, the chief of election consultant IPAC, during a raid by the Enforcement Directorate, the central agency has alleged.

title: "Suggestions" For Tejashwi Yadav, Including A Lalu Yadav Move, After Bihar Loss
content: Bihar's opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal, after two months of introspection into its crushing defeat in the assembly elections, has come up with a long list of causes.

title: 0.1% Conviction In Corruption Cases Filed By Probe Agency ED Since 2015
content: Only eight or 0.1 per cent of 5,892 cases filed by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) under the anti-money laundering law between January 1, 2015, and June 30, 2025, have led to convictions, the government told the parliament.

title: Power Lines Delay Air Ambulance Landing In Madhya Pradesh, Pilot Hovers For 15 Minutes
content: An air ambulance sent to evacuate a critically ill patient in Madhya Pradesh's Dindori was forced to hover for nearly 15 minutes after the pilot found live power lines dangerously close to the helipad.

title: Amid Water Deaths, Indore Collector, Mayor Visit RSS Office, Congress Irked
content: A political controversy has erupted in Madhya Pradesh after Indore Collector Shivam Verma and Mayor Pushyamitra Bhargava visited the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office late on Wednesday.

title: 'If Veep Can...': Top Court On Rajya Sabha Chairman's Role Over Impeachment
content: The Supreme Court said if the vice president can exercise the functions of the president in the absence of the president, then why cannot the Rajya Sabha deputy chairman exercise the functions of the chairman in the absence of the chairman.

title: How A Scrap Of Paper, Sniffer Dog Cracked A 70-Year-Old's Murder In Madhya Pradesh
content: For two months, the murder of 70-year-old Shivnarayan Kaurav haunted Madhya Pradesh's Gangepura village.

title: From Team BJP In 2014 To Trinamool Poll Strategist: All About Pratik Jain
content: After Narendra Modi became the prime minister, Jain co-founded I-PAC, emerging quietly as its operational brain.

title: No Damage To Delhi Mosque, Drone Footage From Demolition Site Reveals
content: A diagnostic centre, a guest house and a community hall were demolished during an anti-encroachment drive carried out by the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) near Faiz-e-Elahi Masjid, close to Ramlila Maidan near Turkman Gate.

title: Fake Marriage, Fake Divorce: UK Visa Plot Unravelled In Gujarat
content: Police in Gujarat's Bharuch district say they have uncovered an illegal immigration scheme that relied on fabricated marriage and divorce documents to help a local woman enter the United Kingdom on a dependent visa.

title: Bangladeshi Muslims To Hit 40% Of Assam Population In Census: Himanta Sarma
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Thursday claimed that "Bangladeshi Muslims" could constitute nearly 40 per cent of the state's population in the next Census.

title: Mamata Banerjee To Lead Protest March Tomorrow Against Probe Agency Raid
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee will lead a protest march here on Friday against the Enforcement Directorate raids at the office of political consultancy firm I-PAC, Trinamool Congress sources said.

title: 1,104 Infiltration Attempts Detected Along India-Bangladesh Border
content: India's eastern frontier with Bangladesh witnessed its most turbulent year in 2025, both in numbers and in narrative.

title: WhatsApp Audio Messages Spread Delhi Mosque Demolition Rumour: Police
content: Misleading audio messages circulated on multiple WhatsApp groups were key to fuelling rumours about the alleged demolition of the Faiz-e-Elahi Mosque near the Turkman Gate, even as officers moved swiftly to counter the narrative, an official said.

title: India's Russian Oil Bet Faces A 500% Tariff Shock From Donald Trump
content: President Donald Trump's latest warning to Prime Minister Narendra Modi-that the US could "raise tariffs on them very quickly" has taken on new urgency as Washington considers a 500 per cent tariff on countries importing Russian oil.

title: US Senate Advances Resolution To Limit Trump's Attacks Against Venezuela
content: The Senate advanced a resolution Thursday that would limit President Donald Trump's ability to conduct further attacks against Venezuela, sounding a note of disapproval for his expanding ambitions in the Western Hemisphere.

title: US Muslim-Majority City Renames Street After Bangladesh's Khaleda Zia
content: The first city in the United States with a Muslim-majority population has renamed one of its roads from Carpenter Street to Khaleda Zia Street to honour former Bangladesh Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, reported Desh Rupantor, a Bangladeshi newspaper.

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Fortress America: Trump cuts US ties to world bodies; pitches $1.5tn defence budget
content: the withdrawal of the united states is one of the most significant retreats from multilateralism in modern history . the move affects 31 United Nations entities and 35 non-UN groups, including key bodies focused on climate, health, and education . this action coincides with Trump's call for a $1.5 trillion defence budget in fiscal year 2027 .

title: India moves to manufacture homegrown air-quality monitoring devices
content: Currently, most instruments used in India for air pollution monitoring are imported Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and India’s position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade. Read More

title: Government not satisfied with X response on Grok misuse
content: Manash Pratim Gohain is a seasoned journalist with over two decades at The Times of India, where he has built a rich body of work spanning education policy, politics, and governance. Renowned for his incisive coverage of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, accreditation reforms, and skilling initiatives, he has also reported on student politics, urban policy, and social movements. His political reportage—both reflective and news-driven—adds depth to his writing, bridging policy with public impact. Through his 2,500 articles and related outlets, he has emerged as a trusted voice in national discourse, particularly in linking education reform to broader societal change. Read More
